elements.description:
Tooltips can be positioned above, below, to the left, or to the right of the target. A Smart Orientation option is included that will attempt to automatically choose a placement based on the real estate available â€“ this attempts to prevent the tooltip from going off the screen. **Note:** tooltips are not recommended for mobile or tablet applications since the hover affordance is inconsistent across devices and platforms (3D touch, tap-and-hold, proximity sensors, etc). See [px-popover](https://www.predix-ui.com/#/components/px-popover/), which is invoked on tap/click instead. ### Usage Basic:
Hover for tooltip
Custom HTML content using the default slot: My Custom Content ### Styling The following custom properties are available for styling. Custom property | Description :----------------|:------------- `--px-tooltip-text-color` | Text color for the tooltip `--px-tooltip-background-color` | Background color for the tooltip `--px-tooltip-border-color` | Border color for the tooltip `--px-tooltip-shadow-color` | Box shadow color for the tooltip `--px-tooltip-max-width` | Max width of the tooltip `--px-tooltip-z-index` | z-index for the tooltip

properties.name: _parentResizable
properties.description: The closest ancestor element that implements `IronResizableBehavior`.

properties.name: _notifyingDescendant
properties.description:
True if this element is currently notifying its descendant elements of
resize.

properties.name: _values
properties.description: Private Properties, used in internal view logic.

properties.name: for
properties.description:
Either the id of the element that the tooltip is anchored to or the element itself.

If an ID is passed, this element must be a sibling of the tooltip.
If an element, location in the dom does not matter.

(Optional)  If not provided, the px-tooltip will be attached to its parent element.

properties.name: delay
properties.description:
The amount of time in miliseconds before the tooltip should appear when the
target element is hovered over.

properties.name: orientation
properties.description:
The direction that the tooltip is displayed relative to the
'for' element.
- 'auto' calculated at render time or resize
- 'left' to the left of the 'for' element
- 'right' to the right of the 'for' element
- 'top' above the 'for' element
- 'bottom' below the 'for' element

properties.name: tooltipMessage
properties.description: The string to be displayed in the tooltip message.

properties.name: opened
properties.description:
This boolean can be used to REQUEST an open/close action to the tooltip
Because the show/hide mechanism are asynchronous this won't represent
the actual presence of the tooltip on the screen, this is represented
by the `visible` property

properties.name: visible
properties.description: Whether the tooltip is currently shown on screen

properties.name: ignoreTargetEvents
properties.description:
If true the tooltip will ignore the targets events it usually listens
to: mouseup/down, mouseleave/enter... Use this to more precisely
manually control the showing/hiding of the tooltip

properties.name: openRequested
properties.description:
True when opened has been requested (i.e set to true) but the tooltip
hasn't been made visible yet. Not needed in most cases but might be
helpful to catch edge states (i.e reclosing the tooltip after a show
request has been issued but the tooltip isn't visible yet)

properties.name: smartOrientation
properties.description:
If smartOrientation is turned on then the tooltip will override the
default orientation to try to better fit on the page. Smart Orientation
will be chosen in a clockwise manner. (Example: for a tooltip with
"right" orientation it will be below if tooltip will go off right side
of the screen, but left if it goes off right *and* bottom side of the
screen).
Note: this feature is only enabled for the "top" or "bottom" orientations

properties.name: _cancel
properties.description: Activates if the user hovers OFF the target element.

properties.name: _tooltipParent
properties.description: An object referring to the tooltip's parent element.

properties.name: mouseCoords
properties.description: If using followMouse the mouse coordinates to display the tooltip at, *in viewport pixels*

properties.name: watchDogTimeout
properties.description:
When shown the tooltip uses a watchdog to ensure it is removed
if the parent is removed. The watchdog runs every watchDogTimeout ms
If you see a performance degradation when showing tooltip you can
increase the watchdog timeout

properties.name: _currTarget
properties.description: The current target that triggered _show. Useful when target is an array

properties.name: _internalDetaching
properties.description: True when detached is caused by px-tooltip code

properties.name: _margin
properties.description: Used internally for calculations, includes carat + spacing from target (5+5)

properties.name: _tooltipPos
properties.description: Current position of the carat

methods.name: notifyResize
methods.description:
Can be called to manually notify a resizable and its descendant
resizables of a resize change.

methods.name: assignParentResizable
methods.description:
Used to assign the closest resizable ancestor to this resizable
if the ancestor detects a request for notifications.

methods.name: stopResizeNotificationsFor
methods.description:
Used to remove a resizable descendant from the list of descendants
that should be notified of a resize change.

methods.name: resizerShouldNotify
methods.description:
This method can be overridden to filter nested elements that should or
should not be notified by the current element. Return true if an element
should be notified, or false if it should not be notified.

params.name: element
params.description:
A candidate descendant element that
implements `IronResizableBehavior`.

return.desc: True if the `element` should be notified of resize.

methods.name: listenEvents
methods.description:
Starts listening to all mouse events (on the target(s)) we are
interested in: mouseenter, mouseup, mouseleave, mousedown

methods.name: unlistenEvents
methods.description:
Stops listening to all mouse events (on the target(s)) we were interested
in: mouseenter, mouseup, mouseleave, mousedown

methods.name: _onFor
methods.description:
This function fires on a change of the 'for' property,
calls _getTarget and sets the target.

methods.name: _onIronResize
methods.description: Make sure the tooltip is positioned properly if currently showing.

methods.name: _getTarget
methods.description: This function sets the target on the component (the item hovered over)

methods.name: _show
methods.description:
This function sets a timeout with the delay value, and if
this.cancel has not been called, moves the tooltip to the DOM root,
and sets the tooltip as visible.
Don't call this manually but set `opened` instead

methods.name: _hide
methods.description:
Hide the tooltip, clear the timer, and move the tooltip back to whence
it came.
Don't call this manually but set `opened` instead

methods.name: setPosition
methods.description:
This function calls the appropriate positioning function,
according to the orientation specified, target and tooltip content

methods.name: _fitOnLeft
methods.description: This function checks if the tooltip can be fitted on the left.

methods.name: _fitOnRight
methods.description: This function checks if the tooltip can be fitted on the right.

methods.name: _fitOnTop
methods.description: This function checks if the tooltip can be fitted on top.

methods.name: _fitBelow
methods.description: This function checks if the tooltip can be fitted below.

methods.name: _findValidSmartOrientation
methods.description:
This function tries the find the appropriate orientation for the current
tooltip and orientation passed. it will try every orientation clockwise
until it finds one that fits, and return the startingOrientation if none fit.

methods.name: _orientationFit
methods.description: This function checks if the tooltip will fit for the given orientation.

methods.name: _doPosition
methods.description:
This function positions the tooltip on left/right/top/bottom irrespective
of everything else, i.e smart orientation.

methods.name: _positionTop
methods.description: This function sets the carat and tooltip position on top.

methods.name: _positionBottom
methods.description: This function sets the carat and tooltip position on bottom.

methods.name: _positionLeft
methods.description: This function sets the carat and tooltip position on left.

methods.name: _positionRight
methods.description: This function sets the carat and tooltip position on right.

methods.name: _getTargetPositionTop
methods.description: This function returns the target position on top

methods.name: _getTargetPositionBottom
methods.description: This function returns the target position on bottom

methods.name: _getTargetPositionLeft
methods.description: This function returns the target position on left

methods.name: _getTargetPositionRight
methods.description: This function returns the target position on right

methods.name: _getTargetPositionCenterOfTopBottom
methods.description:
This function returns the target position on the center of
either the top or bottom.

methods.name: _getTargetPositionCenterOfLeftRight
methods.description:
This function returns the target position on the center of
either the left or right.

methods.name: _getTargetPosition
methods.description:
This function calculates the target position, with passed
parameters

methods.name: _watchDog
methods.description:
Watchdog when the tooltip is showing so it can be removed
if the parent is removed. Returns false when the tooltip is removed.

attributes.name: for

If an ID is passed, this element must be a sibling of the tooltip.
If an element, location in the dom does not matter.
